summary:
Parvesh Verma said Arvind Kejriwal would soon start blaming the electronic voting machines for his defeat.

Date: Jan 09, 2025 10:55 PM IST
Source: Hindustan Times

In a heated exchange, BJP candidate Parvesh Verma criticized Aam Aadmi Party leader Arvind Kejriwal, stating that Kejriwal is fearful of losing in the upcoming elections and is using voter list discrepancies as an excuse.

  • Verma accuses Kejriwal of being gripped by fear of electoral defeat.
  • Kejriwal raised concerns about irregularities in the voter registration process for the New Delhi assembly.
  • Kejriwal reported that 5.5% of the New Delhi assembly votes were registered in just 22 days, suggesting possible fraud.
  • Verma claims that Kejriwal's popularity is declining among voters in New Delhi.
"Arvind Kejriwal is scared. The fear of losing has gripped him... Soon, he will start blaming EVMs for his defeat." - Parvesh Verma

summary:

Date: Jan 09, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

SN Subrahmanyan, chairman of Larsen & Toubro (L&T), faced backlash for suggesting that employees should work 90 hours a week, including Sundays. His remarks sparked a significant response from the public and celebrities alike.

  • Subrahmanyan joined L&T in 1984 and became chairman and MD in October 2023.
  • His comments have been criticized by various stakeholders, including actress Deepika Padukone.
  • Subrahmanyan has overseen several major projects during his tenure at L&T.
  • He has received multiple awards and accolades, including the Eminent Engineer award in 2024.

The incident has triggered discussions around work-life balance and employee well-being in a corporate context.

Joe Biden says he could have defeated Donald Trump: ‘I had the best chance’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Joe Biden says he could have defeated Donald Trump: ‘I had the best chance’

Publication Date: Jan 09, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

US President Joe Biden has stated that he believes he could have won the presidential elections if he had remained in the race, despite not knowing if he would have completed a full term.

  • Biden, 82, withdrew from the presidential race after criticism from his party following a poor debate performance.
  • Vice President Kamala Harris secured the nomination but lost the election to Trump.
  • Biden stated he thought he had a realistic chance of winning against Trump based on unspecified polling data.
  • Biden expressed regret over not effectively countering misinformation during his presidency.
  • He stated that infrastructure projects should have been initiated sooner for better outcomes.
“I really thought I had the best chance of beating him. But I also wasn't looking to be president when I was 85 years old, 86 years old. And so I did talk about passing the baton,” Biden said.

In conclusion, Biden reflects on his past electoral decision and the challenges faced during his term, expressing thoughts on misinformation and infrastructure delays.
newTitle: Joe Biden Claims He Had Best Chance to Defeat Trump

title: Trade Setup for January 10: Will TCS results take Nifty in the right direction? - CNBCTV18
summary:
Trade Setup for January 10: Will TCS results take Nifty in the right direction?

Publication Date: January 10, 2025 | Source: CNBC-TV18

Thursday's trading session favored the bears as the market saw a broad-based sell-off, with the Nifty 50 slipping below 23,550. Most sectors faced losses, but the Nifty's direction for the week hinges on the results from TCS, India's largest IT services company.

  • The Nifty 50 index ended at 23,526.50, nearing the day’s low.
  • TCS's revenue for the December quarter was ₹63,973 crore, down 0.4% from the previous quarter.
  • Foreign investors were net sellers while domestic investors were net buyers.
  • The Nifty has declined over 2% for the week.
TCS reported a revenue in US Dollar terms of $7,539 million, slightly below the expected $7,626 million.

This trading dynamic showcases the significance of TCS’s quarterly results on the broader market, particularly within the IT sector.
newTitle: Trade Setup for January 10: Will TCS results take Nifty in the right direction?

title: Two labourers injured as silo collapses at smelting unit in Chhattisgarh; two others feared trapped - The Hindu
summary:
Silo Collapse Injures Two Workers in Chhattisgarh

Date: January 9, 2025
Source: The Hindu

Two labourers were injured and two others feared trapped after a silo collapsed at a smelting plant in Chhattisgarh’s Mungeli district on Thursday, January 9, 2025.

  • The incident occurred around 1:30 p.m. at Kusum Smelters Private Limited.
  • Preliminary reports indicate that the iron silo, used for storing dust materials, crashed, trapping workers under the debris.
  • Rescue operations were launched shortly after the incident.
  • Two injured workers have been rescued and taken to a hospital in Bilaspur.
  • As many as 350 labourers work at the plant, which produces sponge iron.
  • Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai is overseeing the relief and rescue work.
“Sad news of an industrial accident has been reported at the smelters plant located in Rambod village of Mungeli district. [...] I pray to God for the safety of the workers trapped under the debris and the speedy recovery of the injured.” — Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai

Rescue efforts are ongoing, and the situation remains critical as authorities work to locate the trapped labourers.
newTitle: Silo Collapse Injures Two Workers in Chhattisgarh

title: Supreme Court Dismisses Petitions To Review Its Judgement Refusing To Recognize Same-Sex Marriages - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Dismisses Review Petitions on Queer Marriage Recognition

Publication Date: January 9, 2024 | Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court today dismissed review petitions seeking to challenge its October 2023 verdict that refused to recognize queer marriages in India. The review bench found no errors in the previous judgments.

  1. The Supreme Court's review bench dismissed the petitions against its earlier decision on queer marriage recognition.
  2. Justice PS Narasimha remained as the only original member on the review bench.
  3. The Court acknowledged the need for legislative action for recognizing queer marriages.
  4. It stated that queer couples have a right to cohabit safely, but did not provide legal recognition of their marriages.
  5. Previous judgments highlighted discrimination faced by queer couples but did not rectify these issues.
“We do not find any error apparent on the record. We further find that the view expressed in both judgments are in accordance with law and as such no interference is warranted.”

This decision continues the debate over legal recognition of queer marriages and highlights the call for legislative review regarding the rights of queer unions.
newTitle: Supreme Court Dismisses Review Petitions on Queer Marriage Recognition

title: Malayalam playback singer P Jayachandran passes away in Thrissur hospital - TOI Etimes
summary:
Malayalam playback singer P Jayachandran passes away in Thrissur hospital

Published on: [Insert Publication Date] Source: [Insert Source]

P Jayachandran, the celebrated Malayalam playback singer, has passed away at a private hospital in Thrissur after battling cancer. He was known for his romantic songs and recorded over 16,000 songs across various languages.

  • He earned the National Film Award for Best Male Playback Singer in 1986.
  • Jayachandran received Kerala State Film Award five times.
  • He was awarded the J. C. Daniel Award in 2020, recognizing his contributions to Malayalam cinema.
“His contributions left a lasting impact on the Indian music industry.”

P Jayachandran was born on March 3, 1944, and came from a musical background, greatly influencing his prolific career.
newTitle: Legendary Malayalam Playback Singer P Jayachandran Passes Away

title: Veteran singer P Jayachandran passes away at 80 - The News Minute
summary:
Veteran Singer P Jayachandran Passes Away at 80

Date: January 9, 2023 | Source: Local News

Veteran playback singer P Jayachandran passed away at the age of 80 in Thrissur. Known for his unmatched voice, he sang in multiple languages and was fondly referred to as 'bhaavagayakan'.

  • Jayachandran had a career spanning nearly six decades, recording over 15,000 songs.
  • He received the National Film Award for Best Male Playback Singer in 1985.
  • His notable collaborations include legends like G Devarajan and AR Rahman.
  • He was awarded the JC Daniel award in 2020 for his contributions to cinema.
  • Jayachandran also appeared as an actor in films including 'Nakhakshathangal' and 'Trivandrum Lodge'.
“His mastery over classical music and emotive singing left an indelible mark on the industry.”

Jayachandran's legacy will live on through his immense contribution to Indian music and cinema.
newTitle: Veteran Singer P Jayachandran Passes Away at 80

title: 'Armageddon': Los Angeles wildfires kill 5, wipe out homes, businesses worth billions | 10 points - Hindustan Times
summary:
'Armageddon': Los Angeles Wildfires Kill 5, Wipe Out Homes, Businesses Worth Billions

Date: Jan 09, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Los Angeles wildfires have wreaked havoc, claiming five lives and forcing thousands to evacuate, including many celebrities, while inflicting significant damage on properties and the economy.

  1. The wildfires have devastated communities from the Pacific Coast to Pasadena, destroying properties and businesses worth billions.
  2. The Altadena neighborhood was one of the hardest hit, with approximately 250 homes destroyed.
  3. About 2000 structures have been reduced to ashes, with at least 130,000 residents under evacuation orders.
  4. High winds of up to 137 km/h have made it challenging to control the fires.
  5. Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass highlighted the severity of the situation, calling it the “big one” with multiple wildfires raging.
  6. Celebrities including Leighton Meester, Adam Brody, and Billy Crystal have reported damage to their homes.
  7. Digging deeper into the emotions, Billy Crystal expressed heartbreak over the destruction of his home.
  8. Emergency management officials acknowledged the situation as a natural disaster with widespread power outages affecting around 250,000 people.
  9. Over 1,400 firefighting personnel have been deployed from the state to combat the blazes.
  10. The total estimated damage caused by the fires is around $57 billion.
newTitle: 'Armageddon': Los Angeles Wildfires Kill 5 and Cause Billions in Damage

title: LignoSat: First Wooden Satellite Launches to Orbit for Sustainability - The Hans India
summary:
LignoSat: First Wooden Satellite Launches to Orbit for Sustainability

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Kyoto University

The LignoSat, a groundbreaking wooden satellite, has successfully entered Earth's orbit, representing a milestone in sustainable space technology.

  • The satellite was launched as part of a five-satellite CubeSat mission, reaching an altitude of approximately 400 kilometers.
  • Constructed primarily from magnolia wood, LignoSat features unique design and joins techniques aimed at eco-friendliness.
  • The mission explores the performance of wood in space's harsh conditions, contributing to future sustainable satellite designs.
  • LignoSat could significantly reduce space debris, as wooden satellites are expected to fully burn upon re-entry.
  • Kyoto University's research team aims to understand the resilience of wood as a viable alternative to traditional satellite materials.
“Timber could be used to construct homes and workspaces in space,” said astronaut Takao Doi, emphasizing wood's potential for future space habitats.

LignoSat's mission is a significant step towards sustainable space exploration, providing important data and insights for the future of space technology.
newTitle: LignoSat: First Wooden Satellite Launches to Orbit for Sustainability

title: Video: KTR argues with Hyderabad police over media interaction - The Siasat Daily
summary:
Video: KTR argues with Hyderabad police over media interaction

Date: January 9, 2025 | Source: The Siasat Daily

After being interrogated for over six hours by the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB), KT Rama Rao (KTR), the working president of the Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS), had a heated exchange with Hyderabad police regarding his media interactions.

  • KTR questioned the police about their request to restrict his interaction with the media.
  • The police cited concerns about potential traffic disruptions as their reason for intervening.
  • A video surfaced showing party workers carrying KTR on their shoulders at the Telangana Bhavan after his ACB grilling.
  • KTR stated he has no involvement in corruption and accused Congress leaders of defaming him.
  • He expressed confidence in the judiciary and his commitment to facing any charges.
“Even if faced with a thousand cases, we will confront them. We have complete faith and respect for the courts, laws, and the constitution.”

This incident highlights the political tensions surrounding KTR and ongoing allegations of corruption linked to the Formula E ‘scam’ case.
newTitle: KTR Confronts Hyderabad Police Over Media Interaction After ACB Grilling
